subject: RE: [junit] ant junit performance problem
msgSnippet: Thanks for your response. When I run the tests in the same JVM (from the IDE), it does NOT chew up memory. Therefore, I don t think it s a problem with my
messageBody:
Thanks for your response. When I run the tests in the same JVM (from the
IDE), it does NOT chew up memory. Therefore, I don't think it's a problem
with my code.

--Dan


_____

From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
Sent: Saturday, February 28, 2004 5:30 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] ant junit performance problem


danrabe wrote:

> A full run of our test suite using ant takes about 4 minutes using
> fork="true". The same test suite run in Intelilj IDEA takes less than
> a minute. I figured this was because I had fork="true" on the junit
> task, so I changed it to fork="false". The test execution got
> marginally slower, and eventually I got an OutOfMemoryError.

One of your tests is being a bad boy. I recommend a little
divide-and-conquer to find out which test is chewing up memory.

> Clearly the ant junit task is doing something radically different
> than what happens within the context of IDEA. (The fast same-JVM
> execution also occurs when using eclipse.) Has anyone else
> experienced this? Any clues as to what might be going on?

In my experience, it's a test or production code problem, rather than a
JUnit or Ant problem.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
